Drag and Drop interfaces using react-beautiful-dnd

Deepak Jayaram

VT Maple Script

Group Editor

  • Editor for moving sections and groups around on a page
  • Not for everyone - primarily for lists / list of lists / connected lists

Features

Easy to Style

  • Natural Drag and Drop animations feel weighted and physical
  • Uses native CSS under the hood to achieve smooth animation
  • very minimal restrictions on styling - unopinionated

Accessible

  • Accessible for mouse, touch and keyboard users
  • Ships with support for D&D interactions using only a keyboard
  • Awesome screen reader support (English supported out of the box ðŸ“¦)
  • uses aria attributes for drag interactions, focus and error states

Easy to use API

  • Well written and excellent documentation overall
  • Uses render props to eliminate the need for wrapping divs
  • Freedom to choose your own data representation
  • Plays well with your favorite state management and middleware libraries

API

Components

  • DragDropContext
  • Droppable
  • Draggable

DragDropContext

<DragDropContext>

 1. import { DragDropContext } from 'react-beautiful-dnd';
 2. 
 3. class App extends React.Component {
 4.   onBeforeDragStart = () => {
 5.     // Called just before onDragStart, not used much
 6.     ...
 7.   };
 8. 
 9.   onDragStart = () => {
10.     // a drag has started
11.     ...
12.   };
13. 
14.   onDragUpdate = () => {
15.     // Something has changed during a drag
16.     ...
17.   };
18. 
19.   onDragEnd = () => {
20.   /*(required): A drag has ended. 
21.   It is the responsibility of this responder to synchronously apply 
22.   changes that has resulted from the drag
23.   */
24.    ...
25.   };
26. 
27.   render() {
28.     return (
29.       <DragDropContext
30.         onBeforeDragStart={this.onBeforeDragStart}
31.         onDragStart={this.onDragStart}
32.         onDragUpdate={this.onDragUpdate}
33.         onDragEnd={this.onDragEnd}
34.       >
35.         <div>Hello world</div>
36.       </DragDropContext>
37.     );
38.   }
39. }

overview

onDragEnd

 1. onDragEnd = (result) => {
 2. const { draggableId, source, destination } = result;
 3.  ...
 4.  ...
 5. };
 6.

overview

Droppable

<Droppable>

 1. import { Droppable } from 'react-beautiful-dnd';
 2. 
 3. <Droppable droppableId="droppable-1" type="PERSON">
 4.   {(provided, snapshot) => (
 5.     <div
 6.       ref={provided.innerRef}
 7.       style={{ backgroundColor: snapshot.isDraggingOver ? 'blue' : 'grey' }}
 8.       {...provided.droppableProps}
 9.     >
10.       <h2>I am a droppable!</h2>
11.       {provided.placeholder}
12.     </div>
13.   )}
14. </Droppable>;

overview

Draggable

<Draggable>

 1. import { Draggable } from 'react-beautiful-dnd';
 2. 
 3. <Draggable draggableId="draggable-1" index={0}>
 4.   {(provided, snapshot) => (
 5.     <div
 6.       ref={provided.innerRef}
 7.       {...provided.draggableProps}
 8.       {...provided.dragHandleProps}
 9.     >
10.       <h4>My draggable</h4>
11.     </div>
12.   )}
13. </Draggable>;

overview
